===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|木綿|木綿 (cotton)}}
{{wikipedia|Cotton}}
[[File:CottonPlant.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|綿}} (''men'', ''wata''): raw [[cotton]] on the bush.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|めん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=めん}} {{m|zh|綿|tr=miɛn||wool; cotton; soft, downy}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|めん|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|めん}}

# [[cotton]] {{qualifier|both the fiber and the cloth}}

=====Usage notes=====
As a standalone noun, the term {{m|ja|木綿|tr=momen||cotton|lit=tree or bush + woolly batting}} is used more often.  This is especially true in speech, to avoid ambiguity with the various homophones, such as {{m|ja|面|tr=men||face}} or {{m|ja|麺|tr=men||noodle}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|木綿|もめん}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|わた}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=わた}}.  Originally referred to any [[batting]] or [[stuffing]], which was generally unspun [[silk]].  The meaning shifted after the spread of [[cotton]] in the {{w|Muromachi period}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|わた|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{qualifier|both rare}} {{ja-l|棉}}, {{ja-l|草綿}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|わた}}

# the [[cotton]] plant
# raw [[cotton]]
# [[batting]] or [[stuffing]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=わた|metaphor}} the state of being [[exhausted]] or extremely [[tired]] {{qualifier|likely from the hard work required to pick cotton}}
#: {{ja-usex|'''綿'''のように疲れた|'''わた''' の よう に つかれた|to be as tired as '''cotton''' → to be [[exhausted]]}}
